content.question: Identical blocks <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>A</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>B</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> are initially at rest on ramps inclined at different angles and with their centers of mass at the same height, as shown above. The ramps are frictionless except for rough sections <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> represented by the jagged lines, which have the same coefficient of kinetic friction. The blocks are released. How do the speeds of the blocks compare when they are at the locations represented by the dashed rectangles at the bottom of each ramp?

choices.label: Block <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>A</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> has a greater speed.
Block <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>B</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> has a greater speed.
The blocks have the same speed.

The speeds cannot be compared without knowing the angles of the ramps or the coefficient of kinetic friction in sections <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.

content.answer: Block <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>B</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> has a greater speed.

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
